conclusion: Use principles of electromagnetic induction and relationship between magnetic field strength, angular velocity, and potential difference.
Identify given values: Length of conductor rod is 4L, magnetic induction intensity B, angular velocity ω.
Conductor rod rotates around an axis perpendicular to the paper, magnetic field lines are perpendicular to the rod.
Magnetic field B is constant and acts on the conductor as a source of induced EMF.
Induced EMF ΔV is given by ΔV = BLω.
Substitute given values into the equation: ΔV = 4L × B × ω.
Distance between a and O is very small, potential difference U_{ab} can be approximated as ΔV = 4L × B × ω.
ΔV is the potential difference between the ends of the conductor, directly proportional to length of conductor and angular velocity.
Potential difference U_{ab} between ends a and b is 4L × B × ω.
The potential difference U_{ab} between ends a and b is 4L × B × ω.
